dataset.Description: Indicates which of 2 studies the participant was enrolled through

age_scan.Description: Child's age at the time of the MRI scan session

male.Description: Child's gender, as reported by the parent

other.Description: Race: Other (includes American Indian or Alaska Native; Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander; and Other)

multiracial.Description: Race: Multiracial (parent indicated multiple race categories for child)

parent1_edu.Description: What is the highest degree you have earned? [you = parent who filled out questionnaires]

parent2_edu.Description: What is the highest degree your partner has earned? [partner of parent who filled out questionnaires, if applicable]

income_rank.Description: Which of these categories best describes your total combined family income for the past 12 months? This should include income (before taxes) from all sources, wages, rent from properties, social security, disability and/or veteran's benefits, unemployment benefits, workman's compensation, help from relatives (including child payments and alimony), and so on.

income_median.Description: Median of the parent's income bracket (see income_rank variable)

les_1y_sum.LongName: Stressful life events (Life Events Scale for Young Children)
les_1y_sum.Description: Total stress experienced by the child due to life events that occurred in the last year

parent.Description: Parent who participated with the child during the parent-child interaction task

pos_content_avg.Description: PARCHISY code, positive content is defined as use of praise, explanation, and open-ended questions

pos_affect_avg.Description: PARCHISY code, positive affect is defined as smiling, laughing

neg_content_avg.Description: PARCHISY code, negative content is defined as use of physical control of task or childâ€™s hand/arm/body, use of criticism

neg_affect_avg.Description: PARCHISY code, negative affect is defined as rejection: frowning, cold/harsh voice

piper1_motion.Description: Child's average composite motion during the Piper movie fMRI scan

piper1_outliers.Description: Number of scan volumes during the Piper movie fMRI scan that were either >1mm head motion or >3SD from mean for global signal intensity
